---
title: "import_v1_3.yml"
---

## High-level description
This YAML file defines a configuration for feature flags and segments in version 1.3 of an import format. It specifies two flags with different types and configurations, along with a segment definition used for targeting specific users or groups.

## Symbols

### version
#### Description
Specifies the version of the import format being used.

#### Outputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| version | string | The version number of the import format (1.3) |

### flags
#### Description
An array of feature flag definitions, each with its own configuration.

#### Outputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| flags | array | A list of feature flag configurations |

### flags[0] (flag1)
#### Description
Defines a variant-type feature flag named "flag1" with multiple configuration options.

#### Outputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| key | string | Unique identifier for the flag (flag1) |
| name | string | Display name for the flag (flag1) |
| type | string | Type of the flag (VARIANT_FLAG_TYPE) |
| description | string | Description of the flag |
| enabled | boolean | Whether the flag is enabled (true) |
| variants | array | List of variants for the flag |
| rules | array | Rules for flag distribution |
| metadata | object | Additional metadata for the flag |

#### Internal Logic
The flag1 configuration includes a variant (variant1) with a complex attachment structure, a rule for distribution based on a segment, and metadata labels.

### flags[1] (flag2)
#### Description
Defines a boolean-type feature flag named "flag2" with rollout configurations.

#### Outputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| key | string | Unique identifier for the flag (flag2) |
| name | string | Display name for the flag (flag2) |
| type | string | Type of the flag (BOOLEAN_FLAG_TYPE) |
| description | string | Description of the flag |
| enabled | boolean | Whether the flag is enabled (false) |
| rollouts | array | List of rollout configurations |
| metadata | object | Additional metadata for the flag |

#### Internal Logic
The flag2 configuration includes two rollout rules: one for internal users based on a segment, and another for a 50% rollout to all users.

### segments
#### Description
Defines segments used for targeting specific users or groups in flag rules.

#### Outputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| segments | array | A list of segment configurations |

### segments[0] (segment1)
#### Description
Defines a segment named "segment1" with a string comparison constraint.

#### Outputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| key | string | Unique identifier for the segment (segment1) |
| name | string | Display name for the segment (segment1) |
| match_type | string | Type of matching for the segment (ANY_MATCH_TYPE) |
| description | string | Description of the segment |
| constraints | array | List of constraints for the segment |

#### Internal Logic
The segment1 configuration includes a single constraint that checks if the "fizz" property is not equal to "buzz".

## Configuration
The YAML file defines the following configuration options:

| Option | Type | Default | Description |
|:-------|:-----|:--------|:------------|
| version | string | "1.3" | Version of the import format |
| flags | array | - | List of feature flag configurations |
| segments | array | - | List of segment configurations |

## API/Interface Reference
While this is not an API definition, the structure of this YAML file could be considered an interface for importing feature flag and segment configurations. The main components are:

| Section | Description |
|:--------|:------------|
| flags | Defines feature flags with their types, variants, rules, and metadata |
| segments | Defines segments used for targeting in flag rules |

Each flag and segment has a unique `key` that can be used to reference it within the configuration.
